content.body: The default matcher one looks weird because it’s two lines, but the length is good

I'd really like for us to standardize our terminology for the "anatomy" slide. we've used different names at different points for some of those things and I want to make sure we're really careful to present a unified vocabulary to the committee. I think whatever we decide now will be pretty sticky, so we should also be thinking about docs / teaching materials / tutorials that new devs will encounter in the wild
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: I'd really like for us to standardize our terminology for the "anatomy" slide. we've used different names at different points for some of those things and I want to make sure we're really careful to present a unified vocabulary to the committee. I think whatever we decide now will be pretty sticky, so we should also be thinking about docs / teaching materials / tutorials that new devs will encounter in the wild

content.body: "ident pattern"
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: "ident pattern"

content.body: ok
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: ok

content.body: "custom matcher"
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: "custom matcher"

content.body: so, a "pattern" is anything that's a literal pattern
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: so, a "pattern" is anything that's a literal pattern

content.body: a "custom matcher" is the Symbol matcher protocol
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: a "custom matcher" is the Symbol matcher protocol

content.body: and a "matcher" is a pattern, or an expression (which may or may not have a custom matcher)
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: and a "matcher" is a pattern, or an expression (which may or may not have a custom matcher)

content.body: the "match clause" includes the when, the if, and the RHS. "clause" by itself only works when you're already clearly talking about matching
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: the "match clause" includes the when, the if, and the RHS. "clause" by itself only works when you're already clearly talking about matching
